Pre-Game Insights: The Padres are slight favorites at -120, while the Braves are +120 underdogs.
The run total is set at 6.5, indicating that oddsmakers expect a low-scoring game, likely due to the quality of the starting pitchers.
The Padres have a.263 team batting average, and their ability to hit for power and average puts pressure on opposing pitching staffs.
San Diego's pitching has been stellar, allowing just four runs combined in their last three wins.
The Braves are fighting to extend their season, but the Padres’ home-field advantage will give them a hard battle again.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres are 7-3 in their last 10 games as favorites.
The under is 5-2 in the Padres’ last seven home games.
The Braves are 2-5 in their last seven playoff games as underdogs.
The Padres are 4-1 in their last five games against Atlanta.
